conversation.message:
Hi Company_C—thank you. Sharing the artifacts you requested as a concise write-up.

(1) My “48-hour ramp” approach (artifact-style outline)
Hour 0–4: Context + success criteria
- 30–45 min kickoff with owner: define goal, deadline, quality bar, stakeholders, and “must not break” constraints.
- Capture in a 1-page brief: Objective, Non-goals, Definition of Done, Risks, Comms cadence.

Hour 4–12: Backlog map + critical path
- Build a quick backlog table (Notion/Sheet): Item | Impact | Effort | Dependencies | Owner | Status.
- Identify critical path by dependency chain + deadline risk; label P0/P1.
- Convert to a 3–5 step delivery plan with milestones (what ships each day).

Hour 12–24: Execution environment + first deliverable slice
- Set up repo/docs/tracker, add lightweight QA checklist.
- Ship a “thin slice” that proves the end-to-end path (even if rough) to de-risk integration early.

Hour 24–48: Daily ship rhythm + reporting
- Daily cadence: (a) commit to ship list by 10am, (b) mid-day risk check, (c) end-of-day demo/notes.
- Status template I send: Shipped today | Shipping next | Risks/blocks | Decisions needed (with options).

(2) Workflow example + measurable outcome
- Implemented a simple intake → triage → QA → release workflow using a single tracker with WIP limits and a QA checklist.
- Added “definition of ready/done” and a 15-min daily triage to prevent ambiguous work entering execution.
- Outcome over the next month: on-time delivery improved from ~70% to ~90% and rework/defect-driven back-and-forth dropped (fewer late-stage surprises) because items met readiness criteria before starting.

(3) Paid trial / assessment
Yes—I’m open to a short paid, time-boxed trial (e.g., 4–8 hours or 1–2 days) with clear success criteria and a concrete deliverable.

If your higher-priority candidates don’t close, would this be sufficient to move me to a formal re-application step (or directly to the paid trial)? I’m ready to start immediately.

[TALK]
